intro: Emerus sesban var. aculeata, commonly known as the spiny sesban, is a leguminous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces elongated, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or arid environments. Its ability to fix nitrogen makes it valuable for soil enrichment in agricultural settings.
